page.title: 13Tourists and Wildlife
page.content: The inhabitants do not want the island to be privatised and they welcome Tourists- over 100 thousand come each year-, but they wish they did not come all at once in August! People living on the island enjoy the wildlife very much,providing their gardens are not ruined. There are about thirty deer and about eighty red squirrels. They are allowed to kill rabbits and would not want to kill any of the other creatures. There are many peacocks roaming the island. Visitors have been banned from taking the beautiful feathers away from the island as some people have been seen pulling feathers from the peacocks' tails. Many of the residents eat sea food like crab and lobsters.Otherwise all their food and other supplies come from Poole and Bournemouth.
